desc.objtitle: Christian Passes the Lions, Object 18 (Butlin 829.18)

objnote.p: Butlin 829.18 states that the design was "finished by [William] Blake with only slight reinforcement in pen" by another hand. We attribute most, possibly all, of the coloring to Catherine Blake. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscription: "19 Page 28 Christian passes the lions" below the design.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christian approaches the Palace Beautiful which is guarded by two lions. Christian stands midstride in the middle of the image. He faces away from the viewer, with his back and arms seen head-on, but with his body twisted in such a way that his legs are seen in profile. His head is turned to the left, so that it is also seen in profile. His head is back slightly, and his eyes are raised so he looks up and to the left towards a figure in the background. His mouth is slightly open, and his wide eyes imply a feeling of surprise or fear. His long, curly, hair extends back from his head, as if blowing in the wind. He wears a long, semi-transparent, long-sleeved gown which reveals a muscular physique underneath. His body is covered in small, bloody scrapes or cuts. His left arm is raised vertically, fully extended, as if reaching for the figure in the background. His hand is raised, with fingers spread and palm out, facing the right side of the image. His right arm is extended downward, held away from his body but at his side. He holds a short, thin rod or staff in his right hand, perhaps his walking stick. His left leg is fully visible and extends backwards, with the heel raised and foot barely touching the ground on tiptoe. The hem of the gown is particularly billowing between his feet. His right leg is partially obscured by his left, but parts of the thigh and all of the lower leg are visible. The leg is extended straight downward and twisted so that the viewer sees the back of the leg. The right foot is planted flat on the ground, with its ankles prominent. Two tall, large, stone cliffs or outcroppings stand on either side of Christian, with a smoother path or road in between them—largely obscured by Christian—leading up to the top of a hill in the background. Two large lions lie atop the outcroppings, facing forward. Both lions have curly, bushy manes and large, wide-open eyes. They both look down at Christian below them. The left lion has a flat mouth, and one large, clawed paw reaching from under its head. The paw is shackled, with one link of a chain visible on the shackle. The right lion has a clear smile and more prominently bridged snout than its partner. Both of its large, clawed paws are visible reaching from underneath its head. Both of its paws are shackled with a few links of chain visible as well. Two short shrubs grow on the flat ground at the bottom of the outcroppings, one on either side of Christian. They have pointed tongue or flame-shaped leaves and are perhaps laurels. The ground under the plants is covered in grass. The path continues on the ground between these shrubs and under Christian’s feet. A large building sits at the top of the hill in the background resembling a castle. Large, square walls flank either side of a large doorway or gate in the center of the building, with a triangular top. Similar triangular spires form a parapet of sorts along the top of the wall on either side of the doorway. A taller, rectangular structure can be seen behind the door and spires. A figure, presumably the porter Watchful, stands in front of the building to the left of the doorway, hailing Christian below. The figure stands straight, facing forward. He wears a long, long-sleeved gown covering all of his body except his head, hands, and feet. His head is faint, but he appears to have long hair. His right arm is extended and raised at roughly 135 degrees. The hand is faint, but there appears to be an indeterminate object held in it. The left arm is extended out from the body and bent at the elbow, with the forearm raised vertically. He holds a tall, thin rod or staff in his left hand. He stands with his legs together and straight, and both feet appear to be visible below the hem of the gown.

component.illusobjdesc: Christian approaches the Palace Beautiful which is guarded by two lions. Christian stands midstride in the middle of the image. He faces away from the viewer, with his back and arms seen head-on, but with his body twisted in such a way that his legs are seen in profile. His head is turned to the left, so that it is also seen in profile. His head is back slightly, and his eyes are raised so he looks up and to the left towards a figure in the background. His mouth is slightly open, and his wide eyes imply a feeling of surprise or fear. His long, curly, hair extends back from his head, as if blowing in the wind. He wears a long, semi-transparent, long-sleeved gown which reveals a muscular physique underneath. His body is covered in small, bloody scrapes or cuts. His left arm is raised vertically, fully extended, as if reaching for the figure in the background. His hand is raised, with fingers spread and palm out, facing the right side of the image. His right arm reaches downward, held away from his body but at his side. He holds a short, thin rod or staff in his right hand, perhaps his walking stick. His left leg is fully visible and extends backwards, with the heel raised and foot barely touching the ground on tiptoe. The hem of the gown is particularly billowing between his feet. His right leg is partially obscured by his left, but parts of the thigh and all of the lower leg are visible. The leg is extended straight downward and twisted so that the viewer sees the back of the leg. The right foot is planted flat on the ground, with its ankles prominent.
Christian holds a short, thin rod or staff in his right hand, perhaps his walking stick.

Two tall, large, stone cliffs or outcroppings stand on either side of Christian, with a smoother path or road in between them—largely obscured by Christian—leading up to the top of a hill in the background.

Two tall, large, stone cliffs or outcroppings stand on either side of Christian, with a smoother path or road in between them—largely obscured by Christian—leading up to the top of a hill in the background. The path continues on the ground between these shrubs and under Christian’s feet.

Two tall, large, stone cliffs or outcroppings stand on either side of Christian, with a smoother path or road in between them—largely obscured by Christian—leading up to the top of a hill in the background. Two large lions lie atop the outcroppings, facing forward. Both lions have curly, bushy manes and large, wide-open eyes. They both look down at Christian below them. The left lion has a flat mouth, and one large, clawed paw reaching from under its head. The paw is shackled, with one link of a chain visible on the shackle. The right lion has a clear smile and more prominently bridged snout than its partner. Both of its large, clawed paws are visible reaching from underneath its head. Both of its paws are shackled with a few links of chain visible as well.

Two short shrubs grow on the flat ground at the bottom of the outcroppings, one on either side of Christian. They have pointed tongue or flame-shaped leaves and are perhaps laurels. The ground under the plants is covered in grass.

A large building sits at the top of the hill in the background resembling a castle. Large, square walls flank either side of a large doorway or gate in the center of the building, with a triangular top. Similar triangular spires form a parapet of sorts along the top of the wall on either side of the doorway. A taller, rectangular structure can be seen behind the door and spires.

A figure, presumably the porter Watchful, stands in front of the building to the left of the doorway, hailing Christian below. The figure stands straight, facing forward. He wears a long, long-sleeved gown covering all of his body except his head, hands, and feet. His head is faint, but he appears to have long hair. His right arm is extended and raised at roughly 135 degrees. The hand is faint, but there appears to be an indeterminate object held in it. The left arm is extended out from the body and bent at the elbow, with the forearm raised vertically. He holds a tall, thin rod or staff in his left hand, possibly a walking stick. He stands with his legs together and straight, and both feet appear to be visible below the hem of the gown.

A figure, presumably the porter Watchful, stands in front of the building to the left of the doorway, hailing Christian below. He holds a tall, thin rod or staff in his left hand, possibly a walking stick.

desc.objtitle: Christian Goes Forth Armed, Object 19 (Butlin 829.19)

objnote.p: Butlin 829.19 states that the design was "lightly sketched and coloured by [William] Blake. Prudence and the portcullis have been reinforced [by another hand?] and a streaky sky introduced into the solid architecture above the gateway. The penwork on Christian himself is probably original." We attribute most, possibly all, of the coloring to Catherine Blake. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscription: "12 In the Interpreter's House" below the design.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christian leaves the Beautiful Palace, with Prudence, Charity, Piety, and Discretion close behind. Christian stands midstride—albeit a short stride—at the right of the image, facing right, but turned slightly so that the viewer can see the front side of his body. Christian wears a long, loose cloak or cape, which may drape over armor. Another figure follows after Christian, standing midstride just behind him. The figure is of indeterminate gender, although based on the long, curly hair and more feminine features compared to Christian, she may be a woman. This figure is viewed in profile, facing right so that she(?) looks at Christian. The left half of the image is dominated by the gate of a building, presumably the Palace Beautiful. The gate is simple, with a semicircle arched doorway, and a raised portcullis composed of six spear-like shafts, with prominent pointed heads. The interior of the building can be seen through the doorway, revealing a dark room. A faintly drawn and indeterminate figure sits on a chair or stool in the middle of the room. The figure appears to be gowned, and so is possibly female. She(?) sits in profile, and her head is clearly bent down. Her arms appear to be held in front of her body in her lap, with elbows on legs and forearms bent upward, so that she can hold her head in her hands, with one hand on top of her head, possibly in a position of mourning or grief. Another indeterminate figure stands bent over just within the gate, partially hidden behind the left side of the frame. The figure appears to be gowned, and so is possibly female. Her(?) head also appears to be bent down, expressing mourning or grief. The wall of the building extends to the right of the gate, with a pilaster projecting from it. A third faintly drawn and indeterminate figure stands leaning against the wall to the right of the gate. The figure appears to be wearing a long, loose gown, and so is possibly female. A horizontal line across her(?) torso possibly indicates a belt or girdle. She stands with her arms are behind her back, and her head bent down, possibly in a position of mourning or grief. A line of short, bushy shrubs or trees with several short trunks forms a hedge extending across the image from this pilaster to the right, behind Christian and the figure following him. Behind the shrubs in the background, another portion of the building can be seen, with a tall square wall, another pilaster, and topped by a dome. An indeterminate structure stands in the far background on the right of the image, just to the right of Christian’s shield. The structure appears to be made of three short domes or large stones or boulders. Streaks of clouds and light cover the sky and the wall above the gate, crossing the top of the image, indicating a sunrise or sunset.

component.illusobjdesc: Christian leaves the Beautiful Palace, with Prudence, Charity, Piety, and Discretion close behind. Christian stands midstride—albeit a short stride—at the right of the image, facing right, but turned slightly so that the viewer can see the front side of his body. Christian wears a long, loose cloak or cape, which is transparent to the point that his body is fully visible beneath. The garment parts at his torso, falling down on either side of his lower body. Beneath the cloak, he appears to be wearing armor, as evidenced by the greaves (particularly on his right leg) and a possible helmet. He wears skintight garments of some type on his thighs, chest, and arms, as indicated by a neckline and faint cuffs at his wrists, and revealing a muscular physique underneath. However, it is not as immediately clear that this garment is armor compared to his greaves. His head is turned slightly towards the viewer so that most of his face is visible. It is tilted slightly down and to Christian’s left, with his mouth closed and his eyes gazing ahead of him to the right. Faint lines indicate that his long, curly hair flows behind his neck and shoulders, and that he may be wearing a helmet or other headpiece. His right arm is fully visible, and is held at his side but bent at the elbow, with the forearm extended forward across his chest. His hand is very faintly drawn, but he is possibly holding some indeterminate object. His left arm is mostly obscured behind his torso, but parts of the forearm are visible, held close to his side and reaching downward. The left hand is also faintly drawn, but he holds a short, thin rod or staff in his hand hanging straight down towards the ground. This is perhaps his walking stick, but a sharp point at the end of the shaft suggest that it may also be a sword. A shield is strapped to his left arm, as evidenced by part of the curve of the shield which is visible behind the arm and shoulder. His legs are close together, with his right leg fully visible in profile, straight with the foot flat on the ground. A prominent kneecap and line around the calf suggest he wears a greave on this leg. His left leg is only partially visible as it crosses behind his right leg, but it is extended slightly backward, with the heel up and toes down.
Christian possibly holds an indeterminate object in his faintly drawn right hand.

In his left hand, Christian holds a short, thin rod or staff in his hand hanging straight down towards the ground. This is perhaps his walking stick, but a sharp point at the end of the shaft suggest that it may also be a sword.
A shield is strapped to Christian's left arm, as evidenced by part of the curve of the shield which is visible behind the arm and shoulder.

Christian leaves the Beautiful Palace, with Prudence, Charity, Piety, and Discretion close behind. A figure follows after Christian, standing midstride just behind him. The figure is of indeterminate gender, although based on the long, curly hair and more feminine features compared to Christian, she may be a woman. This figure is viewed in profile, facing right so that she(?) looks at Christian. She wears a long, loose, semi-transparent gown, with the hem falling in many folds at the ankles. The figure’s right arm is fully visible, down at her side, but bent at the elbow so that the forearm is extended forward towards Christian. The right hand is raised, with faintly visible fingers spread, holding Christian’s right upper arm, as if pleading with him. The figure’s right leg is fully visible, bent at the knee with the lower leg extended back slightly, heel raised and toes on the ground. The left lower leg is straight with the foot flat on the ground.
Christian and the figure walk on flat ground, with a large shadow behind Christian and the figure, and another similar dark spot on the ground in front of them.

The left half of the image is dominated by the gate of a building, presumably the Palace Beautiful. The gate is simple, with a semicircle arched doorway, and a raised portcullis composed of six spear-like shafts, with prominent pointed heads. The interior of the building can be seen through the doorway, revealing a dark room. The wall of the building extends to the right of the gate, with a pilaster projecting from it. A line of short, bushy shrubs or trees with several short trunks forms a hedge extending across the image from this pilaster to the right, behind Christian and the figure following him. Behind the shrubs in the background, another portion of the building can be seen, with a tall square wall, another pilaster, and topped by a dome.
A line of short, bushy shrubs or trees with several short trunks forms a hedge extending across the image from this pilaster to the right, behind Christian and the figure following him.

The interior of the building can be seen through the doorway, revealing a dark room. A faintly drawn and indeterminate figure sits on a chair or stool in the middle of the room. The figure appears to be gowned, and so is possibly female. She(?) sits in profile, and her head is clearly bent down. Her arms appear to be held in front of her body in her lap, with elbows on legs and forearms bent upward, so that she can hold her head in her hands, with one hand on top of her head, possibly in a position of mourning or grief.

The interior of the building can be seen through the doorway, revealing a dark room. An indeterminate figure stands bent over just within the gate, partially hidden behind the left side of the frame. The figure appears to be gowned, and so is possibly female. Her(?) head also appears to be bent down, expressing mourning or grief.

A faintly drawn and indeterminate figure stands leaning against the wall to the right of the gate. The figure appears to be wearing a long, loose gown, and so is possibly female. A horizontal line across her(?) torso possibly indicates a belt or girdle. She stands with her arms are behind her back, and her head bent down, possibly in a position of mourning or grief.

An indeterminate structure stands in the far background on the right of the image, just to the right of Christian’s shield. The structure appears to be made of three short domes or large stones or boulders.
Streaks of clouds and light cover the sky and the wall above the gate, crossing the top of the image, indicating a sunrise or sunset.

desc.objtitle: Christian with the Shield of Faith, Taking Leave of his Companions, Object 20 (Butlin 829.20)

objnote.p: Butlin 829.20 states that the design "escaped the going-over [by another hand] suffered by most of the rest of the series." We attribute the unfinished coloring to William Blake. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscriptions: "20" possibly altered from "21" top right, attributed by Butlin to Blake, and "William Blake" bottom right, not in Blake's hand.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christian leaves the Palace Beautiful, followed by a group of people, presumably Discretion, Piety, Prudence, and Charity. Christian stands midstride in the middle of the image, facing the viewer head-on. His head is turned slightly to his right, but his entire face is still visible. His long, curly hair flows behind his neck and shoulders. He wears a headpiece, such as a helmet, cowl, which wraps around his head and covers his entire neck. The top of the helmet above Christian’s forehead has a pattern cut into it resembling a thin crown. Christian wears a long, loose cloak or cape, which is transparent to the point that his body is fully visible beneath. The garment parts at his torso, falling down on either side of his lower body. Beneath the cloak, he wears armor, which covers his entire body. There appear to be creases indicating separate plates of armor at his wrists, just below his shoulders, and at his collarbone just below the neckpiece. The armor is skintight, indicating a muscular physique, especially on his torso and lower legs. His arms are both held close to his body at his sides. His right arm reaches downward, fully extended. His hand is open, with the palm facing the viewer and fingers spread. His left arm is bent upward at the elbow so that his forearm is raised. In this hand he holds a large, round shield, presumably the Shield of Faith. A sword is strapped to his left hip, as evidenced by the hilt with prominent pommel visible below his left arm. The rest of the sword is hidden behind his body. Although he faces forward, he is clearly midstride as his left leg is extended backward and bent at the knee, with the foot on tiptoe. From the viewing angle, his right leg appears to be straight, but it may be extended forward towards the viewer slightly, with the foot planted on the ground, also possibly on its toes. One figure stands to Christian’s left. The figure wears a long, loose, semi-transparent gown, and slightly pronounced breasts suggest that she is female. She faces the viewer, with her head turned slightly to her right, looking at Christian. Her long, curly hair falls behind her neck and shoulders. She has a halo surrounding her head with four prominent beams of light reaching out from the halo. Both arms are at her sides, reaching down and fully extended, with palms facing the viewer and fingers spread. Like Christian, although she faces forward, she is clearly midstride as her right leg is clearly extended backward, but the foot is hidden by the gown. From the viewing angle, her left leg appears to be straight, but it may be extended forward towards the viewer slightly, with the foot on tiptoe. Three similar figures stand to Christian’s right, one in front of the other two. The frontmost figure wears a long, loose, semi-transparent gown, and slightly pronounced breasts suggest that she is female. She faces the viewer, with her head turned slightly to her left, looking at Christian. Her long, curly hair falls behind her neck and shoulders. A few strands of hair on her right side stand on end and resemble flames. She has a halo surrounding her head. Her arms are both close to her sides, but bent upward at the elbow so that forearms and hands are raised. Both hands are raised, with palms facing out towards the viewer and fingers spread. Although she faces forward, she is clearly midstride as her left leg is extended backward and bent at the knee, with the foot on tiptoe. From the viewing angle, her right leg appears to be straight, but it may be extended forward towards the viewer slightly. The right foot is not clearly visible. The two figures behind this one are mostly obscured by her body. The right figure—between Christian and the frontmost woman—is of an indeterminate sex, although the long hair and gown suggest that she is possibly female. She(?) has her head bent back, eyes raised looking up either at Christian’s face or to the sky above them. She wears a long, loose gown and has long, curly hair which falls behind her neck and shoulders. A halo surrounds her head, with two prominent beams of light extending out from it. The figure’s right arm is raised vertically, fully extended, and holds an indeterminate object in her hand. Her left arm is down at her side, reaching down fully extended, and holding a large, flat, indeterminate object, possibly a book, between the forearm and torso. Only her left leg is visible, and it stands straight, with the foot on tiptoe. The leftmost figure is also of indeterminate sex, although the long gown suggests she is possibly female. She(?) wears a long, loose gown. Her hair is short and straight, framing the face. Her head is bent slightly to her left, with eyes raised, possibly looking at Christian’s face or to the sky above them. A halo surrounds her head. Both of the figure’s arms are raised vertically, fully extended with hands raised, palms up. Her legs are hard to distinguish, but it appears that they are crossed with the left leg in front and possibly extending forward slightly, indicating that the figure is midstride. All of the figures walk on a flat, grassy stretch of ground at the bottom of the image, with clear patches of grass and leaves spread across it. A short indeterminate bush or shrub is partly visible at the right edge of the image. It has thin, pointed, flame-like leaves, and is possibly a laurel. Another indeterminate leafy plant is faintly visible on the right edge, just above the rightmost figure’s left hand. It appears to have a few berries on it. A final indeterminate and faintly drawn plant is visible to the right of Christian’s left knee, with a few pointed leaves. A large hill rises behind the figures, filling the upper portions of the image. A large castle-like building sits atop the hill. It is faintly drawn, but has there is a clear large door or gate in the center of the building, with a triangular top. Large, square walls flank either side of the gate, topped with four tall, thin spires extending from these walls, two on either side of the gate. A second set of walls can be seen behind the first, extending farther on either side. The right wall of this set has another spire at its end. Roughly sketched lines to the left of the gate possibly indicate a human figure, standing and facing forward, perhaps the porter Watchful.

desc.objtitle: Christian Beaten Down by Apollyon, Object 21 (Butlin 829.21)

objnote.p: Butlin 829.21 states that the design has been "heavily gone over in all parts," presumably by another hand. We attribute most, possibly all, of the coloring to Catherine Blake. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscriptions: "Page 36" [partly erased?] 20 Christian [altered from "B..."] beaten down by Appollyon" below the design and "Apollyon" above the design.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christian fights the demon Apollyon. Apollyon dominates the image, standing over Christian, facing forward with arms and legs spread, forming a massive X across the image. He skin is either covered in scales or he wears skintight chainmail over his entire body. His arms are both raised at 135 degrees. He holds single short spear in his left hand, and two in his right, all with large, pointed spearheads aimed at Christian below him. His head leans forward and down from his shoulders, and his eyes are down looking at Christian. He has a halo around his head, with several dark beams of light extending out from the halo. The top of his head itself is covered in short spikes, perhaps a helmet or crown, or perhaps his hair standing on end. His eyes are large and fully open. He has a long and wide nose, with a curled mustache underneath. His mouth is open, and three jagged bolts of lightning emit from his mouth. His chest is broad and muscular. His legs are spread wide, one on either side of Christian, with large feet with prominent toes and visible short claws on his right toes. He has large, dark, batlike wings spreading out behind him. His body is cloaked in dark flames, which rise above his head, and extend outward on either side of his torso and down over his left leg. Christian kneels below Apollyon, clearly beaten down by his opponent. He wears armor, most clearly evidenced by the greaves on his legs and the seams between plates of armor on his shoulders, wrists, and knees. His lower body is seen in profile, facing left with his left leg visible to the viewer, while his upper body is twisted to face away from the viewer, making his back visible. The left leg is folded completely, with knee on the ground, foot standing on tiptoe, and thigh bent on top of the calf, so that Christian sits on his left heel. His left arm is raised, but mostly hidden behind his circular shield, the Shield of Faith, with which Christian blocks some of Apollyon’s lightning bolts. His right arm is fully extended, reaching downward to grab his weapon from the ground. The weapon appears to be a sword, with a pommel at the end of a hilt, but there is no crossguard, or if there is, Christian’s hand blocks it from view, so it may be a staff or walking stick. It lies on the ground just below Christian’s right hand, with Apollyon’s left foot standing over it. Christian’s head is turned to the right and bent back, with his eyes raised looking up at Apollyon. He wears a helmet, cowl, or similar headpiece which wraps around his head and covers his neck. A few locks of long, curly hair can be seen flowing out from underneath the headpiece. His mouth is slightly open, in an expression of surprise or fear. An indeterminate object just behind and to the left of Christian is possibly his right leg, bent upward with the knee in the air, but it may also be a tall stone standing in the background. Christian and Apollyon stand on an expanse of flat ground covered in a bloody substance, particularly around Apollyon’s right foot, under Christian’s left leg, and around and on Christian’s weapon. The sky behind Apollyon’s left leg in the background is dark, and upper portions of the sky are fiery, indicating possibly a sunrise or sunset.

Apollyon holds single short spear in his left hand, and two in his right, all with large, pointed spearheads aimed at Christian below him.

It lies on the ground just below Christian’s right hand, with Apollyon’s left foot standing over it. Christian’s head is turned to the right and bent back, with his eyes raised looking up at Apollyon. He wears a helmet, cowl, or similar headpiece which wraps around his head and covers his neck. A few locks of long, curly hair can be seen flowing out from underneath the headpiece. His mouth is slightly open, in an expression of surprise or fear. An indeterminate object just behind and to the left of Christian is possibly his right leg, bent upward with the knee in the air, but it may also be a tall stone standing in the background.
Christian's left arm is raised, but mostly hidden behind his circular shield, the Shield of Faith, with which Christian blocks some of Apollyon’s lightning bolts.

Christian's right arm is fully extended, reaching downward to grab his weapon from the ground. The weapon appears to be a sword, with a pommel at the end of a hilt, but there is no crossguard, or if there is, Christian’s hand blocks it from view, so it may be a staff or walking stick. It lies on the ground just below Christian’s right hand, with Apollyon’s left foot standing over it.
An indeterminate object just behind and to the left of Christian is possibly his right leg, bent upward with the knee in the air, but it may also be a tall stone standing in the background.
Christian and Apollyon stand on an expanse of flat ground covered in a bloody substance, particularly around Apollyon’s right foot, under Christian’s left leg, and around and on Christian’s weapon.
The sky behind Apollyon’s left leg in the background is dark, and upper portions of the sky are fiery, indicating possibly a sunrise or sunset.

desc.objtitle: Faithful's Narrative, Object 22 (Butlin 829.22)

objnote.p: Butlin 829.22 states that the design was "left unfinished by [William] Blake, with some subsequent reinforcement in pen of Christian's head, the outlines of the main figures and the architectural forms behind." We concur and attribute this "subsequent" work to Catherine Blake. We also attribute to her the black coloring of the trees along the left and right margins. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscriptions: "21 Faithful relate how Moses met with him" below the design and "Faithfuls Narrative" above the design.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christian walks with Faithful, who tells his story. The two figures stand in the middle of the image, facing forward; they are midstride, with Faithful on the left and Christian on the right. Christian wears a long, loose cloak or cape, which is transparent to the point that his body is fully visible underneath. The cloak parts at his chest, falling down on either side of his lower body, with its lower hem visible behind and to the right of his left leg. He appears to be wearing other garments underneath, as indicated by a waistline marking the top hem of his pants. Either the cloak or the shirt underneath is long-sleeved, as indicated by lines marking cuffs at his wrists. His head is turned and tilted slightly to his right, looking towards Faithful, and he wears a helmet, cowl, or some other headpiece covering the top of his head and wrapping around the sides of his face and under his chin. His long, curly hair flows out from underneath this headpiece and falls behind his neck and shoulders. Both arms are close to his sides, with his right arm fully extended reaching downward. His right hand is turned to face the viewer palm out, with his thumb clearly spread separate from the other fingers. His left arm is also close to his side, but bent upward at the elbow so that the forearm and hand are raised. The hand is barely visible, but it appears to be open with palm facing out towards the viewer and fingers spread. Although he faces forward, he is clearly midstride as his left leg is extended backward and bent at the knee, with the foot on tiptoe. From the viewing angle, his right leg appears to be straight, but it may be extended forward towards the viewer slightly, with the foot planted on the ground, possibly on its toes. The legs are not spread in a wide stride and are relatively close together. Faithful wears a long, loose, long-sleeved gown with covers all of his body but his head and hands. His head is turned and tilted slightly to his left, looking towards Christian, and he is possibly wearing a hood or some other head covering, although it appears looser than Christian’s. Long, possibly curly hair flows out from under the hood and behind his neck and shoulders. He appears to have a beard. His left arm is held away from his side and bent upward at the elbow so that the forearm and hand are raised. The hand is faintly drawn, but appears to be turned with the palm to the right, and his pointer finger raised up, towards the vignette above his head. One or more other fingers may also be spread. His left arm is close to his side and fully extended reaching downward. His right hand holds his right thigh. Although his gown covers his legs and he faces forward, he appears to be midstride with the right leg extended forward, as evidenced by a bulge in his cloak along his right thigh and knee. Two vignettes fill the space above Faithful and Christian, presumably events from Faithful’s story of his journey. Both vignettes are contained in circular spaces, and both depict pairs of figures in struggles. The left vignette shows two figures more or less side-by-side. The left figure in the vignette is Faithful. He faces left and is seen in profile, although the figure’s torso appears to be twisted so that the upper-back is seen from behind. Both arms are raised vertically above the figure’s head, fully extended. His head appears to be turned to the right so that he looks over his right shoulder to the other figure in the vignette. His left leg is fully extended backward, and his right leg is extended forward and bent at the knee, indicating the he is midstride in a fleeing or running motion. The right figure, the "old Man" (also called "Adam the first") in the vignette faces forward towards the viewer. Its head appears to be turned slightly to the its right, looking at the left figure. It has a broad-shouldered and muscular body. Its right arm is raised at 45 degrees, reaching for the left figure, and perhaps pushing him. The left arm is close to the figure’s side. The figure’s legs are spread wide, with the right leg fully extended towards the right, although the calf and foot are hidden behind the left figure. The left leg is out to the left, but bent at the knee so that the lower leg is vertical. Lines in the figure’s groin possibly indicate male genitals or a loincloth. The right vignette also depicts two figures in a struggle, with one standing over the other. The lower figure in the vignette is Faithful. He lies almost horizontal along the bottom of the scene, seen mostly in profile facing right. His head is bent down. His left arm is raised vertically, fully extended. His right arm is raised horizontally, but bent at the elbow with the forearm folding back towards his head. His hand is possibly bent upwards at the wrist and raised, palm up. His body is folded at the waist—where the upper figure’s foot is planted—and his legs are together, but both bent at the knees and drawn up slightly, as if in an expanded fetal position. There is some uncertainty in the passage illustrated about who the other figure in the vignette is, but he is finally identified as Moses. He stands over slightly right of Faithful. He faces forward towards the viewer. His head appears to be bent down slightly, looking at the other figure. Both arms are raised vertically above its head, with his left arm fully extended and his right bent slightly at the elbow. He appears to hold an indeterminate object in his right hand. He has a broad-shouldered and muscular body. His legs are spread wide as if midstride or lunging. His right leg is extended forward but bent at the knee so that the lower leg is vertical, and he steps on Faithful. His left leg is extended backwards and possibly also bent at the knee. Christian and Faithful walk on a path or road in the lower-middle section of the image, and extending behind them. Grassy hills rise in successive layers on either side of Christian and Faithful. Two barren, leafless trees rise along the left and right margins of the image, framing the scene. Each tree has a small, short branch at about Christian and Faithful’s head-level, reaching towards the vignettes. At least two buildings stand in the background on the right side of the image. The closer one is square, with an arched doorway leading into a dark interior. The second building is behind the first, apparently on a hill above it. This building has a rectangular bottom layer. The upper layer consists of three thin, rectangular, vertical towers on the left, and a dome on the right. Both buildings are partially obscured by the right tree.

desc.objtitle: Vanity Fair, Object 23 (Butlin 829.23)

objnote.p: "Vanity Fair" is inscribed, not by Blake, above the design. Butlin 829.23 states that the design was "left largely unifinished by [William] Blake in pencil and delicate washes, though the colouring of he right-hand mountebank may also be his; the quartering and heavy outlines of the other one were almost certainly added later." We attribute most, possibly all, of the coloring to Catherine Blake. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscription: "23 Christian & Faithful in Vanity Fair" below the design.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christian and Faithful are imprisoned in Vanity Fair. Much of the image is in an incomplete sketch form, except for two male dancers in the center of the image. The right dancer stands facing forward towards the viewer. His upper arms are both raised at 135 degrees, but they are bent at the elbow so that the forearms are raised almost vertically above his head. Both hands have the pointer fingers extended, pointing towards Christian and Faithful in the background, and the other fingers folded in towards the palms. His head is turned in profile and bent back with his eyes raised so that he looks up towards Christian and Faithful. He has short hair smoothed down towards the back of his head. He wears a skintight, long-sleeved, single-piece garment that covers his entire body except for his hands, neck, and head, revealing a muscular physique underneath. The parts of the garment covering the torso and legs are covered in a diamond checkered pattern. The diamonds are checkered red and white the chest, right leg, and lower left legs, and blue and white on the hips, thighs, and upper left leg, with a few blue diamonds on the upper right leg. The garment's feet are without a pattern. The sleeves are plain and separated from the rest of the garment by seams around the shoulders and armpits, and colored green. His torso is twisted in a serpentine stance, so that his right hip is struck out to the side. his right leg is fully extended, standing on tiptoe. His left leg is bent at the knee so that the lower leg is raised and extended backward. The foot is bent sharply down at the ankle, standing on tiptoe on the ground behind his right leg. The left dancer stands facing away from the viewer, with legs and arms spread in an X shape. His arms are both raised vertically above his head and fully extended. His left hand is raised open and bent so that the palm faces up, and his fingers appear to be spread. The right hand is also raised with fingers spread, but with palm facing out away from the viewer. His head is turned in profile and bent back to the point that it is perpendicular to his neck, with his eyes raised so that he looks up towards Christian and Faithful. His mouth is open. His hair is short and smoothed back over his head, except for a row of tight curls at his hairline. He wears a skintight, long-sleeved, single-piece garment that covers his entire body except for his hands, neck, and head, revealing a muscular physique underneath. The garment is patterned into four quarters, with the left arm and torso as one white quarter, the right arm and torso as a black quarter, the left leg as another black quarter, and the right leg as the other white quarter. Both legs are spread and straight, standing on tiptoe. The other six figures in the image are unfinished sketches, with two on each edge of the image, and Christian and Faithful at the top. The lower-left figure is female, based on her long hair and pronounced breasts. She stands in profile, facing right, but with her head turned to her right looking at the dancers so that her face is fully visible. She has long, curly hair which flows down her neck and shoulders. She wears a long, loose gown which covers all of her body but her head and hands. Her right arm is raised at 135 degrees, although it is partially blocked by the left dancer’s left arm. The hand appears to be pointing towards Christian and Faithful. The upper portion of her left arm is hidden behind her body, but the forearm is visible, bent upward at the elbow and raised. In her left hand she holds a mask, much like one of the ancient Greek theatre masks associated with comedy and tragedy. The mask has wide eyes, a widely-opened mouth, and two small circular objects attached to the top. The figure’s buttocks are pronounced, and her right leg is straight, with the foot flat on the floor. Her left leg is hidden behind her right and not visible. A figure stands behind her, but is very loosely sketched. Much of his body is hidden behind the front figure, except his head, chest, and an arm. He wears a tall, conical hat, resembling a bishop’s mitre, and thus he is likely male. He appears to be wearing a loose gown or robe. One of his arms might be raised at 135 degrees, gesturing towards Christian and Faithful. The lower-right figure stands facing forward towards the viewer. Her sex is not clear, but she is likely female to match her counterpart on the left. Her head is tilted slightly to her left, and she has short, curly hair in tight curls around her face. She wears a long, loose gown which covers all of her body but her head and hands. Both arms are down close to her sides, but bent upward at the elbows so that forearms are raised. Her right forearm is raised out to the side, with the hand raised, palm out towards the viewer, and fingers spread. Her left forearm is also raised towards her right, crossing over her torso. In her left hand she holds a mask, similar to her partner’s, although less clearly detailed. Like her partner’s, the mask is similar to ancient Greek theatre masks associated with comedy and tragedy. The mask’s mouth is possibly slightly open. She stands with her legs straight and together, but crossed, with the right leg in front. A figure stands behind her, but is very loosely sketched. Much of its body is hidden behind the front figure, except its head, chest, and an arm. Its sex is not clear, though it is likely male to match its counterpart on the left. He wears a three-pronged crown or other headpiece. He raises one arm, likely his right arm, at 135 degrees, gesturing towards Christian and Faithful with his hand, which is bent at the wrist so that it is flat parallel with the ground. All four of these bottom figures stand on an expanse of flat ground. Behind the four lower figures, a massive structure stands, filling most of the background. The structure has three domes, one large one in the back-center, and two smaller on either side of and in front of the central dome. The two side domes are topped with thin, short spires or spikes, which are then topped with small circular objects just below their tips. A two-stepped dais or platform is situated between the two smaller domes. A tall, vertical pole stands in the middle of this dais, topped with a cross, although it is possible that this shaft is a spire topping the central dome. Christian and Faithful stand on this dais, one on either side of the pole. They are loosely drawn, so it is difficult to tell which is which. The left figure stands mostly facing forward, but turned slightly to his left, facing the viewer's right. His head is straight, and he appears to be looking at the other figure to the right. He appears to have curly hair. He wears a long, loose gown with a belt at his waist. Only his right arm is visible, and it is fully extended down at his side. A length of chain extends from the dais, connected to his belt, with another shorter length connected to his right wrist. He may have a shackle around this wrist and his ankles. The right figure stands in a similar position, although at more of an angle facing his right, the viewer's left. He also wears a long, loose gown. His head is straight and looks at the other prisoner. He has clearly curly hair. Only his left arm is visible, and it is wrapped around his torso, as if hugging himself. A length of chain extends from the dais towards his waist. He is also possibly shackled at his ankles.

desc.objtitle: Faithful's Martyrdom, Object 24 (Butlin 829.24)

objnote.p: Butlin 829.24 states that the design is "unfinished, with outlines reinforced in pen or point of brush and some strengthening of colour in the flames" by another hand. We attribute most, possibly all, of the coloring to Catherine Blake. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscriptions: "24" possibly over a deleted "Page 50" followed by "Faithful taken up into Heaven" below the design and possibly "luckd heaven" in the right margin.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Faithful is martyred at Vanity Fair while Christian and other figures watch. A male figure, possibly Christian, stands facing away from the viewer in the lower-middle portion of the image. He wears a long-sleeved, loose, semi-transparent gown. His shoulders, buttocks, thighs, and calves are visible through the gown. His arms are raised at 135 degrees and fully extended. His hands are raised with palms facing up and away from the viewer and fingers spread. His head is turned to the left so the viewer can see the face in profile. His head is bent back and his eyes are raised so he looks up to the spirit of Faithful in the sky above him. His hair is faintly visible, but appears to be long and curly, flowing down his neck and between his shoulder blades. His mouth is slightly open. He stands with his legs together. The left leg is straight, with foot flat on the ground. His right leg is bent at the knee, and the leg may be extended backward slightly, although it is difficult to tell from the viewing angle. The right foot stands on tiptoe. The right foot stands on tiptoe. Another male figure kneels to the left of the center figure, and he may be Hopeful. He faces right and is mostly viewed in profile, but his body is twisted so that most of his upper chest faces the viewer. His arms are both fully extended, with the right arm raised vertically and the left raised at 135 degrees. Both hands are raised, with both palms up and out towards the viewer, and fingers spread. His head is seen in profile facing right and bent back with his eyes raised so that he looks up and to the right towards Christian. He has short, curly hair. Only his right leg is visible, and it is bent at the knee with the lower leg on the ground. The left leg is hidden behind the right, but the left foot is visible extending behind the right foot. Three clear figures lie on their sides in the lower-right corner of the image, with two possible figures faintly drawn above them along the right edge. The bottom-most figure lies on its side, facing the viewer, but with its upper body raised and supported by its arms. The figure is faintly drawn and of indeterminate sex. It wears a loose, flowing, long-sleeved gown. Its head is turned in profile, facing left, and bent back with eyes raised so that it looks up and to the left towards Christian and Faithful. The figure appears to be wearing a tight-fitting hat around its head, resembling a skullcap, with a thick fringe around the bottom of the cap. Its mouth may be slightly open. Only its right arm is clear, and it crosses over the figure's torso, reaching down to the ground and fully extended, holding its body up. The middle figure of the lower three lies above the lowest figure, but partially hidden behind it. It faces forward towards the viewer, but with its head turned slightly to its right. The figure has distinct facial features, but the sex is not immediately clear, although it appears bald and is therefore likely male. He appears to be lying on its side with his upper body raised, possibly supported by his arms, although they are hidden behind the lowest figure. His face is the only part of this figure that is drawn in any detail, with a large nose, wide eyes which look down and to the left towards Christian and the kneeling figure, a slightly open mouth, and furrowed brows which convey an expression of fear or melancholy. The third figure of the lower three lies above the middle figure, but partially hidden behind it. The figure has very little details drawn, and sex is therefore indeterminate. It appears to be facing away from the viewer, lying with its lower body along the ground (although hidden behind the other figures and Christian), and its upper body raised, so perhaps in the middle of a falling movement. Its arms are both raised vertically, although the left arm is bent at the elbow so that the forearm bends to the right, over the figure’s head. Both hands are raised vertically, with palms to the left and fingers spread. Two more figures possibly stand side-by-side along the right edge above and behind the three on the ground, but they consist solely of two circles with may be heads. In the midground on the left side of the image, Faithful’s corpse stands on fire. He stands facing the viewer, with his body positioned indicating death: head down on his chest, arms crossed and folded over his chest, and legs together, although the legs are largely obscured by the flames which engulf him. The body is gaunt, without hair or a face, burned beyond recognition. The body is surrounded by dark, straight, vertical flames, which resemble spikes or spires. A few of these flames extend towards the center of the image, behind the kneeling figure, with a couple further to the right under Christian’s right arm. The top half of the image is dominated by the spirit of Faithful carried upward by two horses. The spirit of Faithful is shown in profile, flying diagonally up and to the right from his corpse, facing right. He appears as an old man, with long hair flowing down behind his shoulders onto his back. He also has a short beard. His head is bent back slightly, with his eyes raised looking up to the sky. He wears a long, loose, long-sleeved, and semi-transparent gown. Only his right arm is fully visible, and it is down at his side, but bent upward at the elbow so that the forearm is raised. His hand is held in a posture indicating prayer. Only his right leg is fully visible through the gown as the left is hidden behind it, but his legs are together, straight, and fully extended slightly backwards, towards his corpse. The two horses fly to the right of him, also in a diagonal position from lower-left to upper-right, and facing right. They are seen in profile and positioned one behind the other. Only one of the horses is fully visible, the one closer to the viewer. This horse has its head pulled back, eyes wide, and mouth open, with its tongue out and forward. His front legs are fully extended in front of his body, and his hind legs are also fully extended behind his body, as if in mid-gallop. The lower portions of the hind legs, including the hooves, are obscured by Christian. Flame-like shapes of extend back from the horse’s neck, and are possibly locks of hair from its mane, or flames from the fire that surrounds the horses and Faithful. The second horse is largely obscured by the first, with only its head visible above the others, with a similar wide-eyed and open-mouthed expression. More serpentine, billowing flames extend diagonally up to the right, surrounding the spirit of Faithful and the horses which carry him upward. A large dome is visible in the background behind the burning corpse of Faithful, topped with a cross, resembling the dome of St. Paul’s Cathedral.

desc.objtitle: Christian and Hopeful in Doubting Castle, Object 25 (Butlin 829.25)

objnote.p: Butlin 829.25 states that "all the outlines have been gone over and the greys, which fill most of the background, have probably been reinforced" by another hand. We attribute most, possibly all, of the coloring to Catherine Blake. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscriptions: "205" with the "0" possibly remaining from a previous erased inscription, bottom left, and "Christian and Hopeful in Doubting Castle" below the design.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christian and Hopeful are imprisoned in Doubting Castle, and taunted by the giant Despair. The image is dominated by Despair, who is massive in comparison to the other two figures in the image. He stands facing away from the viewer, with his legs straight, but his upper body bent slightly down to his right. He is entirely naked, and very muscular. His left arm is raised at 135 degrees, with a slight bend upward at the elbow. His left hand is raised, with the palm out away from the viewer and fingers spread. His right arm is raised horizontally. His hand is closed, holding two keys which dangle on an unseen chain or keyring. Both arms are fully extended. His head is turned to his right and slightly down, and it is seen in profile. He has short, curly hair. His eyes are down, looking at Christian and Hopeful below him and to his right. He may be frowning. His legs are together, and he has thick, short, curly hair on his buttocks and thighs. The left leg is straight with the foot flat on the floor. The right leg is bent slightly at the knee and the foot stands on tiptoe. The leg is possibly extended slightly behind him, though it is difficult to tell from the viewing angle. The other two figures, Christian and Hopeful, sit on the ground in the lower-right portion of the image. Although they are fairly detailed, they are not detailed enough to differentiate one from the other. The left figure sits on the floor of the cell facing forward. His right leg is folded underneath him, with the knee on the ground. His left leg is drawn up into his body and bent at the knee, with the foot flat on the ground and knee raised. His left arm is at his side, but raised slightly so it rests on his left knee. It is bent upward at the elbow, and the hand holds his head, which is tilted slightly to his left to rest in the hand. He has curly hair. His eyes appear to be down, and this expression—along with his positioning of head in his hand—suggest melancholy or despair. His right arm is not clearly visible, and is possibly behind his back. The right figure also sits facing forward, but with both legs drawn up into his body and crossed at the ankles, feet flat on the ground and knees raised. The legs obscure most of his body from view. His arms are both down at his sides, but bent upward at the elbow, with his hands resting on his knees. His head is deeply folded down into his chest so that his face is not visible at all, and he rests his head on top of his hands, in a clear position of melancholy or despair. The three figures are all inside a large, dark room, likely a prison cell or dungeon. The walls are made of large, dark blocks of stone. A row of particularly dark blocks at the top of the wall above Christian and Hopeful are possibly windows, revealing a dark night sky. An indeterminate object appears to be built into the wall above and to the right of the sitting figures. It has a circular ring at its top, with a short, vertical shaft or rod extending straight down from the ring towards the ground. It is possibly a metal ring for attaching chains and/or shackles. The floor of the cell below the two sitting figures is darker than that under Despair, perhaps indicating shadows or a pool of dark water or some other substance.

desc.objtitle: Christian and Hopeful Escape from Doubting Castle, Object 26 (Butlin 829.26)

objnote.p: Butlin 829.26 states that "the outlines of the figures have been reinforced in ink [by another hand], and the colour of the sky and the tone of the architectural landscape are probably not original." We attribute most, possibly all, of the coloring to Catherine Blake. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscription: "26" possibly altered from "25" and followed by "They escape from Giant Despair" below the design.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christian and Hopeful are shown fleeing from Doubting Castle, with Despair following behind. Christian and Hopeful both stand midstride running away from the castle in the bottom-left corner of the image. Although they are fairly detailed, they are not detailed enough to differentiate one from the other. One stands slightly in front of the other from the viewer’s perspective, obscuring parts of the back figure’s body. The front figure faces left and runs in profile, but with his head and upper body turned slightly away from the viewer, towards the back figure. Only the back of his head can be seen, and he appears to have short hair. He wears a long, semi-transparent, long-sleeved gown. His left arm is extended in front of his body, and raised at 45 degrees. His hand is raised, with the palm vertical and facing left. His right arm is extended slightly behind his body, and also raised at 45 degrees. The hand of this arm is held parallel to the ground, with the palm down. His entire upper body is bent forward at about 45 degrees, leaning into his run. His right leg is extended forward slightly, bent at the knee, with the foot flat on the ground. A short shadow falls behind the right foot. His left leg is extended backward, bent slightly at the knee, with the foot raised off the ground. The back figure stands slightly to the left of the front figure, and he faces forward towards the reader. He wears a long, semi-transparent, long-sleeved gown. His arms are both fully extended and raised, one vertically, the other at 135 degrees. The hands of both arms are raised, with palms facing forward towards the viewer, and fingers spread. He may be wearing a hood over his head, although that might also be his hair, of indeterminate length. His right leg is extended forward, bent at the knee, and with the foot flat on the ground. His left leg is largely hidden behind the front figure so that only the foot and lower calf are seen, but it is clearly extended backward. The foot of this leg stands on tiptoe. Short shadows fall behind both feet. A much longer shadow falls behind both runners, extending across the ground to the right edge of the image. Despair stands behind and to the right of the two running figures, slightly off center of the image. He faces the viewer, standing, but with his upper body leaning to the right onto a wall of his castle, perhaps in the process of fainting or falling. He is a massive giant in comparison to the other figures, completely naked and very muscular, with visible genitals. His head is bent backwards and tilted slightly to his left, into the direction of his lean. His eyes are wide, and stare forward into the distance, as if not focused on anything. His mouth is open, which, combined with his eyes, imply a dazed or stunned expression. His hair is short and curly. His arms are both down at his sides and slack. In his left hand, he holds a massive club made of a knotty branch, which rests on the ground, supporting his weight. His legs are together, but he stands midstride—albeit a short stride. His left leg is slightly forward, standing straight, with the foot flat on the ground. His right leg is very slightly extended backward, and bent at the knee, with the foot standing on tiptoe. A dark shadow extends to the right of Despair's feet, under his club and the wall to the right. In the background behind the figures is Despair’s castle, Doubting Castle. The structure is built around a central tower, which stands in the middle of the image behind Despair. It is made of large, dark, square stones, and has a parapet at the top. A large, square window is built into the center of the tower just below the parapet, with nine smaller panes within, seven of which are squares, and two of which are slightly irregular shaped quadrilaterals (the top line of one and the bottom line of the pane above it are diagonal). A thin, arched window is built into the tower to the left of this large window. A row of short spikes is built into the wall to the right of the central window, just above Despair’s head. A similarly parapeted wall flanks both sides of the central tower, at a slightly shorter height. A second outer wall stands below this upper wall, on either side of the tower. This wall is also made of dark, rectangular stones and with a parapet at its top. A gate or other opening is built into this wall, right in front of the central tower, and Despair stands within this gate. To the left of Despair, a portion of the wall is topped with spikes, and appears to be one door of the gate, opened and at an angle to the viewer. Another similar structure can be seen behind and to the right of Despair, which is the portion of the lower wall that he leans on. Two circular objects are stacked on top of each other at the bottom of this portion of the wall, perhaps hinges for the gate. Behind Despair, a short flight of stairs leads up into the central tower. The sky in the top left corner of the image is dark, but streaks of light cross over this dark portion and lead to brighter skies towards the center and right side of the image, indicating sunrise or sunset behind the central tower.

This wall is also made of dark, rectangular stones and with a parapet at its top. A gate or other opening is built into this wall, right in front of the central tower, and Despair stands within this gate. To the left of Despair, a portion of the wall is topped with spikes, and appears to be one door of the gate, opened and at an angle to the viewer. Another similar structure can be seen behind and to the right of Despair, which is the portion of the lower wall that he leans on. Two circular objects are stacked on top of each other at the bottom of this portion of the wall, perhaps hinges for the gate. Behind Despair, a short flight of stairs leads up into the central tower.

The sky in the top left corner of the image is dark, but streaks of light cross over this dark portion and lead to brighter skies towards the center and right side of the image, indicating sunrise or sunset behind the central tower.

desc.objtitle: The Pilgrims Meet the Shepherds of the Delectable Mountains, Object 27 (Butlin 829.27)

objnote.p: Butlin 829.27 states that "the heads and outlines have been reinforced in pen and ink [by another hand]. The colour of the sky has probably been added; it clashes with the tones of the four shepherds." We attribute most, possibly all, of the coloring to Catherine Blake. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscription: "27 The Shepherds of the Delectable Mountains" above the design.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christian and Hopeful meet four shepherds on the road. Two figures—Christian and Hopeful—stand on the right side of the image. They are fairly detailed, but not detailed enough to differentiate one from the other, although Christian is possibly the left of the two, since he leads. The left figure stands slightly in front of the other from the viewer’s perspective, hiding the lower portion of the back figure’s right leg. He stands midstride, walking along the road, seen in profile facing left. His hair is long and curly, falling down onto his neck and shoulders. His head is bent forward slightly, and his eyes are raised, looking towards the four shepherds ahead of him. He has a clear Adam’s apple in his neck. He wears a long, loose, long-sleeved gown. His left arm is down at his side, but crossed over his chest, with the hand at his right shoulder. He walks with the assistance of a long, thin rod or staff, serving as a walking stick. He holds the staff with one end against his right side and shoulder and the other end diagonally down on the ground in front of him, almost like a crutch, so he possibly holds the upper end of the staff in his left hand. The right arm is also down, fully extended at his side, reaching down along the length of the staff. The arm is held slightly in front of his body, holding the staff at about its midpoint. He stands with one leg straight, with his foot flat on the ground. His other leg is extended backward slightly, and bent at the knee, standing on tiptoe. His gown covers his legs and makes it difficult to tell which leg is which, but faint lines on the gown possibly indicate the calf of the bent leg, indicating that it is the left, and the straight leg is his right. A second figure stands to the right of the first, and slightly behind him. He also stands in profile, facing left. His head is bent down, and he appears to be looking down at the ground. He has long, curly hair which flows onto his neck and shoulders. He wears a long, loose, long-sleeved gown. His left arm is down at his side, but crossed over his chest, with the hand on the right shoulder. Only one leg is fully visible, and it is straight, with the foot flat on the ground. Like the other figure, his gown makes it unclear which leg this is, but it is likely his left leg. The other leg is obscured by the other figure, but appears to also be straight. A sheep stands behind these two figures, with its neck and head visible to the left of the left figure. It holds its head down to the ground, eating grass. This sheep is slightly smaller than the other five with the shepherds, indicating that it may be a lamb. The left half of the image is dominated by four standing shepherds. The leftmost shepherd stands facing away from the viewer, although his body is turned towards Christian and Hopeful. He wears a long, loose, long-sleeved gown and a wide-brimmed hat. His head is seen in profile, looking to the right at Christian and Hopeful. His mouth is slightly open, and he has long hair flowing under the brim of his hat onto his neck and shoulders, as well as a curly beard. Only his right arm is visible, and it is down at his side, but bent upwards at the elbow so that the forearm and hand are raised. He points with his first finger up and to the right, towards the rightmost shepherd, with his thumb also up and all other fingers curled into his palm. Although his left arm is not visible at all, he presumably holds a shepherd’s crook in it, since the hook of the staff is visible above his hat. He stands with both legs straight. His left foot is turned away from the viewer, but flat on the ground, so that all we see is the heel. The right foot is in profile, with the heel raised, standing on tiptoe. The second shepherd from the left stands facing the viewer, but his head is turned slightly towards Christian and Hopeful. He wears a long, loose, long-sleeved gown, and a wide-brimmed hat, although the hat is tipped back in such a way that it resembles a halo around his head. He has a long, curly beard. Lines on his forehead imply an expression of concern. Although his gown hides his legs, he stands with both legs straight. His feet are not visible. The hook of a shepherd’s crook can be seen above and behind his hat, although it is unclear how he holds the staff. His left arm is down at his side, but bent upward at the elbow so that the forearm and hand are raised. His hand points to the right at Christian and Hopeful, although his first finger is not fully extended. His thumb may be raised. However, since the shepherds stand so close together, it is unclear if this arm is actually his left arm, or the next shepherd’s right arm. The next shepherd to the right (second from the right) stands facing the viewer, but his head is turned slightly towards Christian and Hopeful. He wears a long, loose, long-sleeved gown, and a wide-brimmed hat, although the hat is tipped back in such a way that it resembles a halo around his head. He has a long, curly beard and hair. His eyes are wide, looking down, and he has lines in his forehead, indicating an expression of concern. Although his gown hides his legs, he stands with both legs straight. His feet are not visible. The hook of a shepherd’s crook can be seen above and behind his hat, although it is unclear how he holds the staff. His left arm is barely visible behind his stomach, down at his side, fully extended reaching downward, with the hand open and fingers spread. However, since the shepherds stand so close together, it is unclear if this arm is actually his left arm, or the next shepherd’s right arm. The rightmost shepherd stands facing the viewer, but his head is turned slightly towards Christian and Hopeful. He wears a long, loose, long-sleeved gown, and a wide-brimmed hat, although the hat is tipped back in such a way that it resembles a halo around his head. He has a short, curly beard and hair, with particularly curled locks of hair standing out on the top and back of his head. His eyes are wide, looking to the right at Christian and Hopeful. He has lines on his forehead, indicating an expression of concern or possibly surprise when taken alongside his wide eyes. Although his gown hides his legs, he stands with both legs straight. His feet appear to be visible, with the right foot turned directly at the viewer, so that we see the toes, and the left foot in profile, standing on tiptoe. The hook of a shepherd’s crook can be seen above and behind his hat, although it is unclear how he holds the staff. His left arm is down at his side, fully extended reaching downward, and held slightly away from his body. The hand is open with fingers spread and palm facing out towards the viewer. A sheep stands between each shepherd, with two to the right of the rightmost shepherd. Only their heads and necks are visible, which are bent down towards the ground, eating grass. The ground below the figures and the sheep is covered in grass. In the background behind the figures, faint markings indicate rolling hills covered in grasslands and possibly patches of woods. The sky in the top-right corner behind Christian and Hopeful is darker than the other side, with streaks of light reaching across from the left, indicating a sunrise or sunset behind the four shepherds.

However, since the shepherds stand so close together, it is unclear if this arm is actually his left arm, or the next shepherd’s right arm. Similarly, the left arm of the second shepherd from the left might actually be this shepherd's right arm. The arm is down at his side, but bent upward at the elbow so that the forearm and hand are raised, crossing in front of his body. His hand points to the right at Christian and Hopeful, although his first finger is not fully extended. His thumb may be raised.

Because of how close the shepherds stand, it is difficult to tell which arms belong to which shepherd. Therefore, the left arm of the shepherd second from the right might actually be this shepherd's left arm. The arm is, down at his side, fully extended reaching downward, with the hand open and fingers spread and palm facing away from the viewer.

All four shepherds appear to be holding shepherd's crooks, as indicated by the top of the staffs with their hooks above and behind all of their heads. However, it is unclear how any of them hold the staffs since no visible hands hold them.
A sheep stands between each shepherd, with two to the right of the rightmost shepherd. Only their heads and necks are visible, which are bent down towards the ground, eating grass.
The ground below the figures and the sheep is covered in grass.
In the background behind the figures, faint markings indicate rolling hills covered in grasslands and possibly patches of woods.

The sky in the top-right corner behind Christian and Hopeful is darker than the other side, with streaks of light reaching across from the left, indicating a sunrise or sunset behind the four shepherds.

desc.objtitle: Christian and Hopeful in the River, Object 28 (Butlin 829.28)

objnote.p: Butlin 829.28 states that the design was "left unfinished by [William] Blake and miraculously free from later accretions." The coloring of the foliage may have been added by Catherine Blake. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscription: "27 Hopeful [over deleted "C..."] supports Christian over the river" below the design.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This image is a rough, unfinished sketch and therefore lacks much detail. Hopeful and Christian attempt to cross the river before the Gates of Heaven. Faint horizontal lines across the bottom third of the image indicate the presence of the river. One horizontal line about a third of the way from the bottom of the image indicates a shore or bank, upon which two angelic figures stand. Two figures, Christian and Hopeful, swim through the river in the lower-right corner of the image. One of the figures, presumably Christian based on Bunyan's text, has sunk almost entirely into the river, so that only his head is visible above the water. The head is bent back so that it is parallel with the surface of the water. He faces up, and is viewed in profile. He has long, curly hair which falls into the water. He looks up into Hopeful’s face. His mouth may be slightly open. The other figure, presumably Hopeful, is swimming or perhaps wading across the river with his chest, arms, and head above the water. He faces forward, but his head is turned and tilted slightly to his left, and he looks down at Christian’s face below him. His long, curly hair blows in the wind to behind him to the right, over is left shoulder. His left arm is raised at about 45 degrees and curled around Christian’s head, which he holds, supporting it in the crook of his elbow and on his forearm. His right arm is raised horizontally and fully extended. He points to the left, towards the two other figures in the image. Two figures stand on the left edge of the image, at the upper bank of the river. They are not as detailed as Christian and Hopeful, but detailed enough to tell that they are angels. They stand side by side, and are virtually identical. The left angel wears a long, loose gown. It faces forward, but with its head turned slightly to the right and bent down, in the direction of Christian and Hopeful. It has no eyes or facial features, but clearly looks at them. A large halo surrounds the angel’s head. Its large right wing is visible behind the right side of its body, folded up, but with a large bulge over the right shoulder. The right angel wears a long, loose gown. It faces forward, but with its head turned slightly to the right and bent down, in the direction of Christian and Hopeful. It has no eyes or facial features, but clearly looks at them. A large halo surrounds the angel’s head. Its large left wing is visible behind the lift side of its body, folded up, but with a large bulge over the left shoulder. Small beams of light emanate from the angels in all directions. Faintly drawn bush-like shapes fill the upper-right quadrant of the image, indicating shrubbery, trees, or other vegetation growing along the riverbank and in the background. Short, vertical lines under some of the bush shapes just to the right of the angels' feet and their heads possibly indicate tree trunks.
