desc.objtitle: Christian and Hopeful at the Gates of Heaven, Object 29 (Butlin 829.29)

objnote.p: Butlin 829.29 states that "the heads of Christian and Hopeful and their two attendant angels have been reinforced in pen and ink, and, although the rainbow-like bands of colour running through the figures are [William] Blake's, some of the heavier touches of colour on the angels' wings may have been added" by another hand. We attribute the coloring of the background, lower left, and the landscape at the bottom to Catherine Blake. Butlin also quotes the following marginal inscription: "29 [possibly over an erased "Page 50"] Christian & Hopeful enter the gate of Heaven" below the design.

illustration.illusobjdesc: Christian and Hopeful approach the Gates of Heaven, surrounded by a heavenly host. Christian and Hopeful float in the center of the image. They look almost identical, so it is difficult to tell which is which. Both figures are in a vertical position, but hovering slightly above the ground, and thus appear to be flying or floating towards the gates. The left figure faces away, but with his head turned to his right and viewed in profile. He wears a long, loose, long-sleeved, and semi-transparent gown, revealing a muscular physique underneath, particularly along his back. His long, curly hair flows down his neck and onto his left shoulder. He looks directly at the other figure to his right. His right arm is raised vertically and fully extended. The hand is raised, pointing towards the gates at the top of the image in the background. The hand appears to be turned with the palm facing left, and fingers spread. His left arm is hidden behind the right wing of the angel to his left. His legs are visible through his gown. They are together, with the right leg fully extended and straight. The left leg is bent slightly at the knee, with the lower leg extended slightly backward, and crossing over his right ankle. The left foot is pointed, and the right foot is not visible, hidden within the billowing hem of his gown. The right figure faces left and is viewed in profile. He wears a long, loose, long-sleeved, and semi-transparent gown. His long, curly hair flows down his neck and blows behind him in the wind. He looks directly at the other figure to his left. His right arm is raised vertically and fully extended. The hand is raised with the palm out towards the viewer, and fingers spread, gesturing to the gates at the top of the image in the background. His left arm is down at his side, but bent at the elbow so that the forearm crosses over his chest. The left hand also gestures at the gates, but appears to be turned with the palm facing right, with fingers spread. His body twists at the waist, so that his legs are seen from behind instead of in profile. His legs are faintly visible through his gown. They are together, with the right leg fully extended and straight. The left leg is bent slightly at the knee, with the lower leg extended slightly backward, and crossing over his right leg. Neither foot is clearly seen, hidden in the billowing hem of the gown, but a faint outline of the left foot might be visible, and it appears pointed. Christian and Hopeful are flanked on either side by an angel flying alongside them. The left angel faces away from the viewer, but its head is turned to the right and seen in profile. Its head is bent down slightly as it looks at Christian and Hopeful directly to its right. Its long, curly hair flows down its neck and onto its left shoulder. Its wings are both fully unfolded and raised, forming a V overhead and ending in sharp points. The point of the right wing almost touches the point of the other angel’s left wing. Feathers are drawn into the wings along their lower edges. The angel wears a long, loose gown. Its legs are together, fully extended, and straight, although they cannot be clearly seen through its gown. One foot, perhaps the left foot, can be seen through the hem of the gown, and it is pointed. The right angel faces away from the viewer, but its head is turned to the left and seen in profile. Its head is bent down slightly as it looks at Christian and Hopeful directly to its left. Its long hair flows down its neck, blowing in the wind behind him. Its wings are both fully unfolded and raised, forming a V overhead and ending in sharp points. The point of the left wing almost touches the point of the other angel’s right wing. Feathers are drawn into the wings along their lower edges. The angel wears a long, loose, semi-transparent gown. Its legs are together and partially visible through the gown, particularly its left leg. This leg is bent at the knee, with the thigh vertical and the lower leg raised at a 90 degree angle and extended backward. From the viewing angle, we see the sole of the foot, with a couple toes clearly drawn, and the bulge of the calf behind the foot. The right leg appears to be fully extended and straight, and the foot may be visible through the hem, although not clearly. It appears to be pointed. The background and upper portions of the image are filled with a host of many angels, including four that are larger and more detailed than the others. In the upper-left corner, one angel faces forward with its head tilted slightly to the left. It appears to have its wings spread, almost horizontally, in a shallow V. The right arm appears to be raised at 45 degrees. It wears a long, loose gown. A second head-like shape floats over this angel’s right shoulder, possibly the head of another angel behind it. Behind these figures are the suggestion of additional heads of angels. Another group of figures floats below and to the right of this figure. One angel in this group is prominent and hovers in front of others, who are faintly suggested by their heads and gowned bodies. The central figure wears a long, loose gown and faces forward; it may look toward the right. Its arms appear to be down at its sides, close to its body. Another pair of figures floats to the right of this group. One angel of the pair is larger and more clearly depicted. It wears a long, loose gown and faces forward and to the right. Its arms are down at its sides, close to its body. The second angel in this pair hovers to the right of the first, and is suggested by a faint head and body, with little detail. A final angel floats in the upper-right corner of the image, facing forward. Its head is tilted to the left and hangs down. It appears to have its wings spread, almost horizontally, in a shallow V, although the wings may instead be arms. The near-horizontal position of the wings and the hanging head possibly suggest a crucified posture. A third arm-like appendage is raised at 45 degrees, but bent at the elbow so that the forearm and hand are raised. This arm may belong to another figure hidden behind the angel. A second head-like shape over the left shoulder of the angel may also belong to another figure hidden behind. Several faintly drawn heads and bodies of other angelic figures appear in the center of the image below the gates and city in the background. The sky behind Christian, Hopeful, and all the angels is filled with dark, billowing clouds that rise to a fiery, smoky bulbous shape in the center of the image behind the points of the lower angels’ inner wings. A heavenly city sits the very top of the image in the background, behind the large heavenly host. The city is composed of several mountain-shaped triangular spires, forming a crownlike shape. A dome stands at the far right end of the city, topped by a cross, reminiscent of St. Paul's Cathedral. The sun rises or sets behind the city, filling the upper portions of the sky with beams of light. Faintly drawn shapes at either end of the city are possibly two more angels. The left one appears to be facing forward, floating in a near vertical position, with both arms raised at 45 degrees. The right one appears to be floating in a horizontal position, with its head to the right. A small line extending to the left from this angel indicates that it may be blowing on a trumpet or other horn instrument. Bushy shrubs or trees spread along the lower edge of the image, below the feet of Christian, Hopeful, and the lower angels.

They look almost identical, so it is difficult to tell which is which. His long, curly hair flows down his neck and onto his left shoulder. He looks directly at the other figure to his right. His right arm is raised vertically and fully extended. The hand is raised, pointing towards the gates at the top of the image in the background. The hand appears to be turned with the palm facing left, and fingers spread. His left arm is hidden behind the right wing of the angel to his left. His legs are visible through his gown. They are together, with the right leg fully extended and straight. The left leg is bent slightly at the knee, with the lower leg extended slightly backward, and crossing over his right ankle. The left foot is pointed, and the right foot is not visible, hidden within the billowing hem of his gown.

Christian and Hopeful approach the Gates of Heaven, surrounded by a heavenly host. Christian and Hopeful float in the center of the image. They look almost identical, so it is difficult to tell which is which. Both figures are in a vertical position, but hovering slightly above the ground, and thus appear to be flying or floating towards the gates. The right figure faces left and is viewed in profile. He wears a long, loose, long-sleeved, and semi-transparent gown. His long, curly hair flows down his neck and blows behind him in the wind. He looks directly at the other figure to his left. His right arm is raised vertically and fully extended. The hand is raised with the palm out towards the viewer, and fingers spread, gesturing to the gates at the top of the image in the background. His left arm is down at his side, but bent at the elbow so that the forearm crosses over his chest. The left hand also gestures at the gates, but appears to be turned with the palm facing right, with fingers spread. His body twists at the waist, so that his legs are seen from behind instead of in profile. His legs are faintly visible through his gown. They are together, with the right leg fully extended and straight. The left leg is bent slightly at the knee, with the lower leg extended slightly backward, and crossing over his right leg. Neither foot is clearly seen, hidden in the billowing hem of the gown, but a faint outline of the left foot might be visible, and it appears pointed.

Christian and Hopeful approach the Gates of Heaven, surrounded by a heavenly host. Christian and Hopeful are flanked on either side by an angel flying alongside them. The left angel faces away from the viewer, but its head is turned to the right and seen in profile. Its head is bent down slightly as it looks at Christian and Hopeful directly to its right. Its long, curly hair flows down its neck and onto its left shoulder. Its wings are both fully unfolded and raised, forming a V overhead and ending in sharp points. The point of the right wing almost touches the point of the other angel’s left wing. Feathers are drawn into the wings along their lower edges. The angel wears a long, loose gown. Its legs are together, fully extended, and straight, although they cannot be clearly seen through its gown. One foot, perhaps the left foot, can be seen through the hem of the gown, and it is pointed.

Christian and Hopeful approach the Gates of Heaven, surrounded by a heavenly host. Christian and Hopeful are flanked on either side by an angel flying alongside them. The right angel faces away from the viewer, but its head is turned to the left and seen in profile. Its head is bent down slightly as it looks at Christian and Hopeful directly to its left. Its long hair flows down its neck, blowing in the wind behind him. Its wings are both fully unfolded and raised, forming a V overhead and ending in sharp points. The point of the left wing almost touches the point of the other angel’s right wing. Feathers are drawn into the wings along their lower edges. The angel wears a long, loose, semi-transparent gown. Its legs are together and partially visible through its gown, particularly its left leg. This leg is bent at the knee, with the thigh vertical and the lower leg raised at a 90 degree angle and extended backward. From the viewing angle, we see the sole of the foot, with a couple toes clearly drawn, and the bulge of the calf behind the foot. The right leg appears to be fully extended and straight, and the foot may be visible through the hem, although not clearly. It appears to be pointed.

Christian and Hopeful approach the Gates of Heaven, surrounded by a heavenly host. The background and upper portions of the image are filled with many angels, including four that are larger and more detailed than the others. In the upper-left corner, one angel faces forward with its head tilted slightly to the left. It appears to have its wings spread, almost horizontally, in a shallow V. The right arm appears to be raised at 45 degrees. It wears a long, loose gown. A second head-like shape floats over this angel’s right shoulder, possibly the head of another angel behind it. Behind these figures are the suggestion of additional heads of angels.

Christian and Hopeful approach the Gates of Heaven, surrounded by a heavenly host. The background and upper portions of the image are filled with a host of many angels, four of which are larger and more detailed than the others. One group of figures floats above and to the left of Christian and Hopeful. One angel in this group is prominent and hovers in front of others, who are faintly suggested by their heads and gowned bodies. The central figure wears a long, loose gown and faces forward; it may look toward the right. Its arms appear to be down at its sides, close to its body. Another pair of figures floats to the right of this group. One angel of the pair is larger and more clearly depicted. It wears a long, loose gown and faces forward and to the right. Its arms are down at its sides, close to its body.

Christian and Hopeful approach the Gates of Heaven, surrounded by a heavenly host. The background and upper portions of the image are filled with a host of many angels, four of which are larger and more detailed than the others. A pair of figures floats above and to the right of Christian and Hopeful. One angel of the pair is larger and more clearly depicted. It wears a long, loose gown and faces forward and to the right. Its arms are down at its sides, close to its body. The second angel in this pair hovers to the right of the first, and is suggested by a faint head and body, with little detail.

Christian and Hopeful approach the Gates of Heaven, surrounded by a heavenly host. The background and upper portions of the image are filled with a host of many angels, four of which are larger and more detailed than the others. One angel floats in the upper-right corner of the image, facing forward. Its head is tilted to the left and hangs down. It appears to have its wings spread, almost horizontally, in a shallow V, although the wings may instead be arms. The near-horizontal position of the wings and the hanging head possibly suggest a crucified posture. A third arm-like appendage is raised at 45 degrees, but bent at the elbow so that the forearm and hand are raised. This arm may belong to another figure hidden behind the angel. A second head-like shape over the left shoulder of the angel may also belong to another figure hidden behind.

Christian and Hopeful approach the Gates of Heaven, surrounded by a heavenly host. Several faintly drawn heads and bodies of other angelic figures appear in the center of the image below the gates and city in the background.

The sky behind Christian, Hopeful, and all the angels is filled with dark, billowing clouds that rise to a fiery, smoky bulbous shape in the center of the image behind the points of the lower angels’ inner wings.
crown

A heavenly city sits the very top of the image in the background, behind the large heavenly host. The city is composed of several mountain-shaped triangular spires, forming a crownlike shape. A dome stands at the far right end of the city, topped by a cross, reminiscent of St. Paul's Cathedral. The sun rises or sets behind the city, filling the upper portions of the sky with beams of light.
The sun rises or sets behind the city, filling the upper portions of the sky with beams of light.

A heavenly city sits the very top of the image in the background, behind the large heavenly host. Faintly drawn shapes at either end of the city are possibly two more angels. The left one appears to be facing forward, floating in a near vertical position, with both arms raised at 45 degrees.
holding

A heavenly city sits the very top of the image in the background, behind the large heavenly host. Faintly drawn shapes at either end of the city are possibly two more angels. The right one appears to be floating in a horizontal position, with its head to the right. A small line extending to the left from this angel indicates that it may be blowing on a trumpet or other horn instrument.

Bushy shrubs or trees spread along the lower edge of the image, below the feet of Christian, Hopeful, and the lower angels.
